previous.body:
Now I'm onto intervals. This one merges all intersecting intervals and returns the distinct items.

___

# Solution
```python
class Solution:
    def merge(self, intervals: List[List[int]]) -> List[List[int]]:
        res = []
        intervals = sorted(intervals)
        start, end = intervals[0]
        for item in intervals[1:]:
            if end >= item[0] and item[1] > end:
                end = item[1]
            if start >= item[0] and start <= item[1]:
                start = item[0]
            if end < item[0] or start > item[1]:
                res.append([start, end])
                start, end = item
        res.append([start, end])
        return res
```
O(n) = nlog(n) due to the sorted() method

next.body:
Now I'm on to stacks. I had to rethink my strategy of going from right to left, to left to right. I was overcomplicating it.

___

# Solution
```python
class Solution:
    def evalRPN(self, tokens: List[str]) -> int:
        stack = []
        for token in tokens:
            if token in ['+', '/', '+', '-', '*']:
                right = int(stack.pop())
                left = int(stack.pop())
                match token:
                    case '+':
                        res = left + right
                    case '/':
                        res = left / right
                    case '+':
                        res = left + right
                    case '-':
                        res = left - right
                    case '*':
                        res = left * right
                stack.append(res)
            else:
                stack.append(token)
        return int(stack[-1])

            
```
O(n) = n since we iterate over all elements once. Space complexity also O(n) = n for the stack.

post.body:
This took me a long time to cover all cases. 

___

# Solution
```python
class Solution:
    def insert(self, intervals: List[List[int]], newInterval: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        start, end = newInterval
        inserted = False
        res = []
        for item in intervals:
            if end < item[0]:
                if not inserted:
                    res.append([start, end])
                    inserted = True
                res.append(item)
            elif end >= item[0] and end <= item[1]:
                start = item[0] if item[0] < start else start
                end = item[1]
            elif start >= item[0] and end <= item[1]:
                start, end = item
                res.append([start, end])
                inserted = True
            elif start >= item[0] and start <= item[1] and end > item[1]:
                start = item[0]
            elif start > item[1]:
                res.append(item)

        if not inserted:
            res.append([start, end])
        return res
            
```
O(n) = n since we iterate over all elements once.

___

## Improvements
This solution has the same complexity, but it is simpler thereby being more maintanable.

```python
class Solution:
    def insert(self, intervals: List[List[int]], newInterval: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        res = []
        n = len(intervals)

        i = 0
        while i < n and intervals[i][1] < newInterval[0]:
            res.append(intervals[i])
            i += 1

        while i < n and newInterval[1] >= intervals[i][0]:
            newInterval[0] = min(intervals[i][0], newInterval[0])
            newInterval[1] = max(intervals[i][1], newInterval[1])
            i += 1
        
        res.append(newInterval)
        res.extend(intervals[i:])

        return res
```
